PROMPTSETDATA.DATAEDITOR: <PRPTS ontop="1"><PRPTBOX><TALENDs.00 haslist="0" msgnr="-1" msginsert="" altview="0" promptname="TALEND#" ReadFromTable="OPSE"></TALENDs.00><TRACKs.00 haslist="0" msgnr="-1" msginsert="" altview="0" promptname="TRACK#" ReadFromTable="OPSE"></TRACKs.00><WORKFLOW_NAMEs.00 haslist="0" msgnr="-1" msginsert="" altview="0" promptname="WORKFLOW_NAME#" ReadFromTable="OPSE"></WORKFLOW_NAMEs.00><YAML_FILEs.00 haslist="0" msgnr="-1" msginsert="" altview="0" promptname="YAML_FILE#" ReadFromTable="OPSE"></YAML_FILEs.00><STAGE_FILEs.00 haslist="0" msgnr="-1" msginsert="" altview="0" promptname="STAGE_FILE#" ReadFromTable="OPSE"></STAGE_FILEs.00></PRPTBOX></PRPTS>

SCRIPT.MSCRI:
:DEFINE &DIR_WF#, string, 100 :FILL &DIR_WF#[] = STR_SPLIT(&WF_DIR#, "\") :SET &NEW_DIR# = '\'
:SET &FILE_NAME_KEY# = docs :SET &QUEUE# = QUEUE.&TALEND# :SET &LEN# = LENGTH(&DIR_WF#[], SIZE) :SET &VAR# = 2 :WHILE &VAR# LE &LEN# : PRINT TE DIR &DIR_WF#[&VAR#] : SET &directory# = &DIR_WF#[&VAR#] : SET &XML# = CREATE_PROCESS(NEW) ! Create the directory : INC JOBI.WRITE.XML "<XML_DOCU>" = "DOCU.FOLDER" : SET &OBJECT_TYPE# = "DOCU_"&DIR_WF#[&VAR#] : SET &IMPORT_DIR# = &NEW_DIR# : IF &DIR_WF#[&VAR#] <> 'WORKFLOWS' : SET &NEW_DIR# = STR_CAT(&NEW_DIR#, &DIR_WF#[&VAR#]) : SET &NEW_DIR# = STR_CAT(&NEW_DIR#, "\") : ENDIF : P THE IMPORT DIRECTORY IS &IMPORT_DIR# : INC JOBI.BUILD_XML_FILE_TO_DISK_THEN_IMPORT_XML : CLOSE_PROCESS &XML#
: SET &VAR# = &VAR# + 1 :ENDWHILE
:SET &directory# = JOBS :SET &XML# = CREATE_PROCESS(NEW) !Create the directory :INC JOBI.WRITE.XML "<XML_DOCU>" = "DOCU.FOLDER" :SET &OBJECT_TYPE# = "DOCU_JOBS" :SET &IMPORT_DIR# = &NEW_DIR# : INC JOBI.BUILD_XML_FILE_TO_DISK_THEN_IMPORT_XML : CLOSE_PROCESS &XML#
:SET &XML# = CREATE_PROCESS(NEW) :SET &directory# = &JOBS_DIR# ! Create the directory :INC JOBI.WRITE.XML "<XML_DOCU>" = "DOCU.QUEUE" :SET &OBJECT_TYPE# = "QUEUE" :SET &IMPORT_DIR# = &QUEUE_DIR# :INC JOBI.BUILD_XML_FILE_TO_DISK_THEN_IMPORT_XML :CLOSE_PROCESS &XML#

:INC JOBI.SET_ENVIRNOMENT_VARIABLES :PSET &MASTER_RUNID# = &$ACTIVATOR_RUNID# :PSET &WALMART_ROOT# = GET_VAR(VARA.ENVIRONMENT, WALMART_ROOT) :PSET &AGENT# = GET_VAR(VARA.ENVIRONMENT, AGENT) :PSET &LOGIN# = GET_VAR(VARA.ENVIRONMENT, LOGIN) :PSET &QUEUE_DIR# = GET_VAR(VARA.ENVIRONMENT, QUEUE_DIR) :PSET &TEMP_DIR# = GET_VAR(VARA.ENVIRONMENT, TEMP_DIR) :PSET &EXPORT_FILE# = GET_VAR(VARA.ENVIRONMENT, EXPORT_FILE) :PSET &EXPORT_FILE# = RESOLVE_VAR(&EXPORT_FILE#) :PSET &@OS# = GET_VAR(UC_HOST_JCL_VAR,&AGENT#)
:SWITCH &@OS# : CASE UNIX : PSET &SLASH# = '/' : CASE WINDOWS : PSET &SLASH# = '\' :ENDSWITCH
:SET &STG# = &WORKFLOW_NAME# :SET &EXT# = &WORKFLOW_NAME# :SET &WF_LOC# = WORKFLOWS :SET &JOB_LOC# = JOBS :IF &TRACK# <> '' : PSET &WF_DIR# = &WALMART_ROOT#\&TALEND#\&TRACK#\&WF_LOC# : PSET &JOBS_DIR# = &WALMART_ROOT#\&TALEND#\&TRACK#\&JOB_LOC# : SET &FILE_DIR# = STR_CAT(&FILE_DIR#,&SLASH#) : SET &FILE_DIR# = STR_CAT(&FILE_DIR#,&TALEND#) : SET &FILE_DIR# = STR_CAT(&FILE_DIR#,&SLASH#) : SET &FILE_DIR# = STR_CAT(&FILE_DIR#,&TRACK#) :ELSE : PSET &WF_DIR# = &WALMART_ROOT#\&TALEND#\&WF_LOC# : PSET &JOBS_DIR# = &WALMART_ROOT#\&TALEND#\&JOB_LOC# : SET &FILE_DIR# = STR_CAT(&FILE_DIR#,&SLASH#) : SET &FILE_DIR# = STR_CAT(&FILE_DIR#,&TALEND#) :ENDIF
:PSET &FILE_DIR# = STR_LC(&FILE_DIR#) :PSET &QUEUE# = 'QUEUE.&TALEND#' :SET &ALIAS# = '' :INC JOBI.ACTIVATE_OBJECT &OBJECT_TO_ACTIVATE# = SCRI.CREATE.DIRECTORY
:WHILE SYS_STATE_JOB_ACTIVE(SCRI.CREATE.DIRECTORY)= 'Y' :ENDWHILE
:SET &XML# = CREATE_PROCESS(NEW) : INC JOBI.WRITE.XML "<XML_DOCU>" = "DOCU.EXT.STG.jb" : SET &OBJECT_TYPE# = "WF" : SET &IMPORT_DIR# = &JOBS_DIR# : SET &FILE_NAME_KEY = 'EAS' : P THE IMPORT DIRECTORY IS &IMPORT_DIR# : INC JOBI.BUILD_XML_FILE_TO_DISK_THEN_IMPORT_XML : CLOSE_PROCESS &XML#
:SET &XML# = CREATE_PROCESS(NEW) : INC JOBI.WRITE.XML "<XML_DOCU>" = "DOCU.EXT.STG.WF" : SET &OBJECT_TYPE# = "WF" : SET &IMPORT_DIR# = &WF_DIR# : SET &FILE_NAME_KEY = 'EAS' : P THE IMPORT DIRECTORY IS &IMPORT_DIR# : INC JOBI.BUILD_XML_FILE_TO_DISK_THEN_IMPORT_XML : CLOSE_PROCESS &XML# : SET &VAR# = &VAR# + 1

! ********************************************************************************** ! ** Create Job ! ** Purpose: This will build the job. ! ********************************************************************************** ! ** ! Create a new process to write the XML to :SET &JOBS# = PREP_PROCESS_VAR(&CON#) :SET &QUEUE# = QUEUE.&TALEND#
:PROCESS &JOBS# ! Get the XML from the Document Object replacing script variables using STR_SUB_VAR : SET &JOB_NAME# = GET_PROCESS_LINE(&JOBS#, 2) : p job name &JOB_NAME# : SET &JOB_TO_RUN# = GET_PROCESS_LINE(&JOBS#, 1) : SET &JOB_PARAM# = GET_PROCESS_LINE(&JOBS#, 3) : PRINT &JOB_PARAM# : SET &PLACEHOLDER# = GET_VAR(VARA.VALID_TALEND_COMPONENTS, &JOB_NAME#) : SET &JOB_NAME# = STR_UC(&JOB_NAME#) : SET &OBJ_TYPE# = GET_OH_IDNR(&JOB_NAME#) : p Object Type = &obj_type# ! If the job is a Master job there is no need to generate a job. : IF SUBSTR(&JOB_NAME#, 1, 3)= "MJ." : SET &OBJ_TYPE# = 1 : ENDIF : IF &OBJ_TYPE# = 0 : P &FILE_NAME_KEY# "-" &OBJ_TYPE#
! If the &obj_type# = 0 it means the object needs to be created. : SET &XML# = CREATE_PROCESS(NEW)
! Create the Job Header : INC JOBI.WRITE.XML "<XML_DOCU>" = "DOCU.JOB.HEADER" : P JOB_PARAM = &JOB_PARAM# : IF SUBSTR(&JOB_PARAM#, 1, 1)= ":" : SET &PARAM_DATA# = 'TRUE' : ELSE : SET &PARAM_DATA# = 'FALSE' : ENDIF ! Add the variables to the job : P &&PLACEHOLDER# = &PLACEHOLDER# : IF &PLACEHOLDER# <> 'PLACEHOLDER' : IF &PARAM_DATA# = 'TRUE' : P JOB NAME &JOB_NAME# : SET &COM_PARAM_JOB# = '&CON_PARAM#_&JOB_TO_RUN#' : P &COM_PARAM_JOB# = &CON_PARAM#_&JOB_TO_RUN# : SET &VB# = PREP_PROCESS_VAR(&COM_PARAM_JOB#) : PROCESS &VB# : SET &PARAM# = GET_PROCESS_LINE(&VB#, 1) : SET &PARAM_VALUE# = GET_PROCESS_LINE(&VB#, 2) : P tHE &&PARAM# &PARAM# : SET &POS# = STR_FIND(&PARAM_VALUE#, 'jobName') : IF &POS# > 0 : SET &PARAM_VALUE# = STR_SUB(&JOB_NAME#, ".", "_") : ENDIF
: P THE PARAMETERS &PARAM# AND &PARAM_VALUE# : INC JOBI.WRITE.XML "<XML_DOCU>" = "DOCU.JOB.VARIABLES" : ENDPROCESS : CLOSE_PROCESS &VB# ! : INC JOBI.REMOVE_OBJECT &VARA# = &COM_PARAM_JOB# : ENDIF : ENDIF ! Add the Job Trailer : INC JOBI.WRITE.XML "<XML_DOCU>" = "DOCU.JOB.TRAILER"
! Write the XML data to the OS : SET &OBJECT_TYPE# = "JOBS" : SET &IMPORT_DIR# = &JOBS_DIR# : INC JOBI.BUILD_XML_FILE_TO_DISK_THEN_IMPORT_XML : CLOSE_PROCESS &XML# : ENDIF :ENDPROCESS :CLOSE_PROCESS &JOBS#

! ********************************************************************************** ! ** Create Job ! ** Purpose: This will build the workflow. ! ********************************************************************************** ! ** : DEFINE &STRINGS#, string, 100 : SET &QUEUE# = QUEUE.&TALEND#
! Create an array of jobs used to process and put them in the order they will be ! placed in the workflow
: SET &JOBS_LAYOUT# = PREP_PROCESS_VAR(&CON_WF_CR#) : SET &STRINGS#[1] = 'start' : PROCESS &JOBS_LAYOUT# : SET &JB# = GET_PROCESS_LINE(&JOBS_LAYOUT#, 1) : SET &KEY# = GET_PROCESS_LINE(&JOBS_LAYOUT#, 6) : p &KEY# and &JB# : SET &STRINGS#[&KEY#] = &JB# : p **** The job &STRINGS#[&KEY#] key = &KEY# : ENDPROCESS : SET &LEN# = LENGTH(&STRINGS#[], SIZE)
: SET &LOOP_CNT# = 2 : IF &LEN# > 1 : SET &WORKFLOW_NAME# = SUBSTR(&FILE_NAME_KEY#, 3) : SET &WORKFLOW_NAME# = STR_CAT('WF', &WORKFLOW_NAME#)
: SET &XML# = CREATE_PROCESS(NEW) : SET &CNT# = FORMAT("1", "0") : SET &LNR# = &CNT# : SET &ROW# = &CNT# : SET &LOC# = 1 : SET &LOC# = FORMAT(&LOC#, "0") : SET &COL# = FORMAT("1", "0") : SET &HIGH_CNT# = 1 : SET &HIGH_COL# = 1 ! : SET &PRELNR# = FORMAT("1", "0")
! Create the Job Header : INC JOBI.WRITE.XML "<XML_DOCU>" = "DOCU.JOBP.HEADER"
! Create the Jobp Body - Start : set &OBJECT_NAME# = "START"
: P *****CREATE THE JOBP HEADER
: INC JOBI.WRITE.XML "<XML_DOCU>" = "DOCU.JOBP.BODY.START"
: P ***** CREATE THE JOBP BODY ! : SET &JOBS# = PREP_PROCESS_VAR(&CON#)
! Create the Jobp Body - Task : WHILE &LOOP_CNT# <= &LEN# ! : PROCESS &JOBS# : SET &OBJECT_NAME# = &STRINGS#[&LOOP_CNT#] : SET &JOB_NAME# = GET_VAR(&CON#, &STRINGS#[&LOOP_CNT#], 1) : SET &JOB_NAME# = STR_SUB(&JOB_NAME#, '_', '.') : SET &JOB_NAME# = STR_UC(&JOB_NAME#) : SET &OBJ_TYPE# = GET_OBJECT_TYPE(&JOB_NAME#) : IF SUBSTR(&JOB_NAME#,1,3) = 'MJ.' : SET &JOB_NAME# = STR_CUT(&JOB_NAME#,4) : SET &JOB_NAME# = STR_CAT('WF.',&JOB_NAME#) : SET &OBJ_TYPE# = 'JOBP' : ENDIF ! : SET &LNR# = GET_PROCESS_LINE(&JOBS#, 5)
: PRINT OBJECT_NAME:&OBJECT_NAME# JOB NAME:&JOB_NAME# OBJECT_TYPE:&OBJ_TYPE# : SET &COL# = GET_VAR(&CON_WF_CR#, &OBJECT_NAME#, 1) : SET &ROW# = GET_VAR(&CON_WF_CR#, &OBJECT_NAME#, 2) : SET &PRELNR# = GET_VAR(&CON_WF_CR#, &OBJECT_NAME#, 5) : IF &PRELNR# > &HIGH_CNT# : SET &HIGH_CNT# = &PRELNR# : ENDIF : IF &COL# > &HIGH_COL# : SET &HIGH_COL# = &COL# : ENDIF : SET &LOC# = GET_VAR(&CON_WF_CR#, &OBJECT_NAME#, 5) : SET &LNR# = &PRELNR# : PRINT LNR:&LNR# COL:&COL# ROW:&ROW# PRELNR:&PRELNR# : SET &LNR# = FORMAT(&LNR#, '0') : SET &COL# = FORMAT(&COL#, '0') : SET &ROW# = FORMAT(&ROW#, '0') : SET &PRELNR# = FORMAT(&PRELNR#, '0') : SET &LOC# = FORMAT(&LOC#, '0')
: INC JOBI.WRITE.XML "<XML_DOCU>" = "DOCU.JOBP.BODY.HEADER"
: SET &ROWS_WF# = PREP_PROCESS_VAR(&CON_WF#, , &OBJECT_NAME#, 2) : SET &ROWS# = GET_PROCESS_INFO(&ROWS_WF#, ROWS) : IF &ROWS# = 0 : SET &CNT# = 1 : SET &PRELNR# = 1 : SET &PRELNR# = FORMAT(&PRELNR#, '0') : SET &CNT# = FORMAT(&CNT#, '0') : INC JOBI.WRITE.XML "<XML_DOCU>" = "DOCU.JOBP.PRECONDITION" : ELSE : SET &CNT# = 1 : PROCESS &ROWS_WF# : SET &JOB# = GET_PROCESS_LINE(&ROWS_WF#, 2) : P *** &JOB# : SET &PRELNR# = GET_VAR(&CON_WF_CR#, &JOB#, 5) : INC JOBI.WRITE.XML "<XML_DOCU>" = "DOCU.JOBP.PRECONDITION" : ENDPROCESS : ENDIF : CLOSE_PROCESS &ROWS_WF# : INC JOBI.WRITE.XML "<XML_DOCU>" = "DOCU.JOBP.BODY.FOOTER" ! : ENDPROCESS : SET &LOOP_CNT# = &LOOP_CNT# + 1 : ENDWHILE ! Create the Jobp Body - End
: P ***** CREATE THE JOBP TRAILER : set &OBJECT_NAME# = "END" : SET &COL# = &HIGH_COL# + 1 : SET &LNR# = &HIGH_CNT# : SET &ROW# = 1 : SET &LOC# = &LNR# + 1 : SET &COL# = FORMAT(&COL#, "0") : SET &LOC# = FORMAT(&LOC#, "0") : SET &ROW# = FORMAT(&ROW#, "0") : INC JOBI.WRITE.XML "<XML_DOCU>" = "DOCU.JOBP.BODY.END.HEADER" : SET &CNT# = 1 : SET &PREJOB# = PREP_PROCESS_VAR(&CON_WF_CR#, , 'END', 4) : PROCESS &PREJOB# : SET &JOB# = GET_PROCESS_LINE(&PREJOB#, 1) : SET &PRELNR# = GET_VAR(&CON_WF_CR#, &JOB#, 5) : PRINT &&JOB# IS &JOB# : SET &CNT# = FORMAT(&CNT#, "0") : SET &PRELNR# = FORMAT(&PRELNR#, "0") : INC JOBI.WRITE.XML "<XML_DOCU>" = "DOCU.JOBP.PRECONDITION" : SET &CNT# = &CNT# + 1 : ENDPROCESS : CLOSE_PROCESS &PREJOB# : INC JOBI.WRITE.XML "<XML_DOCU>" = "DOCU.JOBP.BODY.END.FOOTER"
! Add the Job Trailer : INC JOBI.WRITE.XML "<XML_DOCU>" = "DOCU.JOBP.TRAILER"
! Write the XML data to the OS : SET &OBJECT_TYPE# = "JOBP" : SET &IMPORT_DIR# = &WF_DIR#
: INC JOBI.BUILD_XML_FILE_TO_DISK_THEN_IMPORT_XML
: ENDIF
! Remove all the temp vara objects used to hold to the data from the XML file. ! :INC JOBI.REMOVE_OBJECT &VARA# = &CON# ! :INC JOBI.REMOVE_OBJECT &VARA# = &CON_WF# ! :INC JOBI.REMOVE_OBJECT &VARA# = &CON_WF_CR#
:PUT_VAR &VARA_HOLDING_PROCESSED#, &FILE_NAME_KEY#, 'YES' :DELETE_VAR &CLEAN_UP#, &FILE_NAME_KEY# :DELETE_VAR &VARA_HOLDING_JOB#, &FILE_NAME_KEY# :DELETE_VAR &VARA_HOLDING#, &FILE_NAME_KEY#

! ********************************************************************************** ! ** Get Connections ! ** Purpose: This will read the XML to see if it contains connections used to build ! ** workflow. ! ********************************************************************************** ! ** ! Check to see if the workflow has ROWS :SET &CON_JOBS# = PREP_PROCESS_VAR(&CON#) :SET &ROWS# = GET_PROCESS_INFO(&CON_JOBS#, ROWS) :SET &ROWS# = FORMAT(&ROWS#,"0") :P THE NUMBER OF ROWS &ROWS# :CLOSE_PROCESS &CON_JOBS#
:IF &ROWS# > 1
! Set the variable to the file to read : SET &FILE_TO_READ# = STR_LC('&FILE_PATH#&FILE_NAME#.item') ! Create a connection to the XML file to process. : SET &HND# = PREP_PROCESS_FILE(&AGENT#, &FILE_TO_READ#) ! Create a connection to the XML file to build used to write to disk then import. : SET &CONNECTION# = XML_PROCESS_TO_DOM(&HND#)
: PRINT **** Getting the connections **** ! Set the point to the connection node in the XML file : SET &CONNECTION# = XML_SELECT_NODE(&CONNECTION#, "connection")
: IF &CONNECTION# <> "" ! First we need to retrieve the Source : SET &SOURCE# = XML_GET_ATTRIBUTE(&CONNECTION#, "@source") : PRINT The source is &SOURCE#
: IF &SOURCE# <> "" : INCLUDE JOBI.GET_CONNECTION_DATA : SET &WF_CNT# = 1 : SET &WF_CNT# = FORMAT(&WF_CNT#, "00")
: WHILE &CONNECTION# <> ""
: SET &SOURCE# = XML_GET_ATTRIBUTE(&CONNECTION#, "@source") : SET &TARGET# = XML_GET_ATTRIBUTE(&CONNECTION#, "@target") : SET &CONN_NAME# = XML_GET_ATTRIBUTE(&CONNECTION#, "@connectorName") : P SOURCE:&SOURCE# AND TARGET:&TARGET# AND CONNECTION:&CONN_NAME# : IF &SOURCE# <> '' : SET &isACTIVE# = 'true' : if &SOURCE# <> "COMPONENT_ERROR" : SET &SUB_SUBELEMENT# = XML_GET_FIRST_CHILD(&CONNECTION#) : WHILE &SUB_SUBELEMENT# <> "" : SET &NAME# = XML_GET_ATTRIBUTE(&SUB_SUBELEMENT#, "@name") : SET &VALUE# = XML_GET_ATTRIBUTE(&SUB_SUBELEMENT#, "@value") : SET &SUB_SUBELEMENT# = XML_GET_NEXTSIBLING(&SUB_SUBELEMENT#) : PRINT "attribute value: &SOURCE# &TARGET# &NAME# &VALUE#" : IF &NAME# = 'ACTIVATE' : SET &isACTIVE# = &VALUE# : p isACTIVE is &isACTIVE# : ENDIF : ENDWHILE : ELSE : SET &isACTIVE# = 'false' : ENDIF : IF &isACTIVE# = 'true' : SET &SOURCE# = STR_UC(&SOURCE#) : SET &TARGET# = STR_UC(&TARGET#) : P &WF_CNT#, &SOURCE#, &TARGET# : PUT_VAR &CON_WF#, &WF_CNT#, &SOURCE#, &TARGET# : SET &WF_CNT# = &WF_CNT# + 1 : SET &WF_CNT# = FORMAT(&WF_CNT#, "00") : ENDIF
: SET &CONNECTION# = XML_GET_NEXTSIBLING(&CONNECTION#) : ELSE : SET &CONNECTION# = '' : ENDIF : ENDWHILE
: ENDIF : ENDIF :ENDIF

! ********************************************************************************** ! ** Process PRE_CONDITION_PARALLEL ! ** Purpose: This will lay the jobs on the workflow template and then once the data ! ** has been gather it will update the vara which will be used later to build the ! ** workflow. ! ********************************************************************************** ! Check to see if the workflow has ROWS :SET &CON_JOBS# = PREP_PROCESS_VAR(&CON#) :SET &ROWS# = GET_PROCESS_INFO(&CON_JOBS#, ROWS) :SET &ROWS# = FORMAT(&ROWS#,"0") :P THE NUMBER OF ROWS &ROWS# :CLOSE_PROCESS &CON_JOBS#
:IF &ROWS# > 1 : SET &ROWS# = &ROWS# + 1 : DEFINE &END_ARR#, string, 100 : DEFINE &ORDER_ARR#, string, 100 : DEFINE &CON_ARRAY#, string, 100 : DEFINE &UPDATE_VARA#, string
: SET &LOC# = 2 : SET &COL# = 2 : SET &LAST_JOB_UPDATED# = ''
! Check to see if the workflow has PARALLEL : SET &WFLOOP_JOBS# = PREP_PROCESS_VAR(&CON_WF#, , TPARALLELIZE_1, 1) : SET &ROWS1# = GET_PROCESS_INFO(&WFLOOP_JOBS#, ROWS) : CLOSE_PROCESS &WFLOOP_JOBS#
: SET &WFLOOP_JOBS# = PREP_PROCESS_VAR(&CON_WF#, , TPARALLELIZE_1, 2) : SET &ROWS2# = GET_PROCESS_INFO(&WFLOOP_JOBS#, ROWS) : CLOSE_PROCESS &WFLOOP_JOBS#
: P HOW MANY IN COL1 &ROWS1# AND COL2 &ROWS2#
! Build an array of all the jobs the need to be processed. : SET &JOB# = PREP_PROCESS_VAR(&CON#) : PROCESS &JOB# : SET &KEY# = GET_PROCESS_LINE(&JOB#, 6) : SET &JOB_NAME# = GET_PROCESS_LINE(&JOB#, 1) : SET &CON_ARRAY#[&KEY#] = &JOB_NAME# : ENDPROCESS : CLOSE_PROCESS &JOB#
: SET &CNT# = 2
! Loop though the array with all the individuals jobs. : WHILE &CNT# <= &ROWS# : SET &NEXT_JOB# = '' : P The job to process &CON_ARRAY#[&CNT#] : SET &JOB_PRE1# = PREP_PROCESS_VAR(&CON_WF#, , &CON_ARRAY#[&CNT#], 2) ! The word PROCESS is used to create a loop though the vara. : PROCESS &JOB_PRE1# ! Get Process Line is used to gather a column from the row just read. : SET &PRE_JOB# = GET_PROCESS_LINE(&JOB_PRE1#, 2) : PRINT PRE_JOB = &PRE_JOB# : ENDPROCESS : CLOSE_PROCESS &JOB_PRE1#
: IF &PRE_JOB# <> '' : SET &JOB_PRE2# = PREP_PROCESS_VAR(&CON_WF#, , &PRE_JOB#, 1) : SET &ROWPRE# = GET_PROCESS_INFO(&JOB_PRE2#, ROWS) : PRINT ***** &ROWPRE# : IF &ROWPRE# > 1 : P &&CON_WF_CR#.&PRE_JOB# &CON_WF_CR#.&PRE_JOB# : SET &VARA_TEMP# = &CON_WF_CR#.&PRE_JOB# : INC JOBI.CREATE_VARA_TEMPLATE &VARA_NAME# = &VARA_TEMP#
: PROCESS &JOB_PRE2# : SET &PRE_JOB# = GET_PROCESS_LINE(&JOB_PRE2#, 3) : PUT_VAR &VARA_TEMP#, &PRE_JOB#, '' : ENDPROCESS : ENDIF : CLOSE_PROCESS &JOB_PRE2# : ENDIF
: SET &JOB_PREDSUCCESSOR# = PREP_PROCESS_VAR(&CON_WF#, , &CON_ARRAY#[&CNT#], 1) : PROCESS &JOB_PREDSUCCESSOR#
: SET &POST_JOB# = GET_PROCESS_LINE(&JOB_PREDSUCCESSOR#, 3) : P &&POST_JOB# &POST_JOB# : SET &POS# = STR_FIND(&POST_JOB#, 'TPAR') : PRINT POS = &POS# : IF &POS# > 0 : SET &JOB_SUCCESOR# = PREP_PROCESS_VAR(&CON_WF#, , &POST_JOB#, 1) : SET &ROWSuc# = GET_PROCESS_INFO(&JOB_SUCCESOR#, ROWS) : IF &ROWSuc# > 0 : P &&CON_WF_CR#.&CON_ARRAY#[&CNT#] &CON_WF_CR#.&POST_JOB# : SET &VARA_TEMP# = &CON_WF_CR#.&POST_JOB# : INC JOBI.CREATE_VARA_TEMPLATE &VARA_NAME# = &VARA_TEMP# : ENDIF : PROCESS &JOB_SUCCESOR# : SET &JOB# = GET_PROCESS_LINE(&JOB_SUCCESOR#, 3) : PUT_VAR &VARA_TEMP#, &JOB#, '' : ENDPROCESS : CLOSE_PROCESS &JOB_SUCCESOR# : ENDIF : ENDPROCESS : CLOSE_PROCESS &JOB_PREDSUCCESSOR# : SET &CNT# = &CNT# + 1 : ENDWHILE
: SET &CNT_END_ARR# = 1 ! This section will find all the ends : SET &CNT# = 2 : WHILE &CNT# <= &ROWS# : SET &JOB_NAME# = &CON_ARRAY#[&CNT#] : SET &JOB_SUCCESSOR# = PREP_PROCESS_VAR(&CON_WF#, , &JOB_NAME#, 1) : SET &ROWS_END# = GET_PROCESS_INFO(&JOB_SUCCESSOR#, ROWS) : CLOSE_PROCESS &JOB_SUCCESSOR# : P &JOB_NAME# &ROWS_END# : IF &ROWS_END# = 0 : PUT_VAR_COL &CON_WF_CR#, &JOB_NAME#, 4, END : SET &END_ARR#[&CNT_END_ARR#] = &JOB_NAME# : SET &CNT_END_ARR# = &CNT_END_ARR# + 1 : ELSE : PUT_VAR_COL &CON_WF_CR#, &JOB_NAME#, 4, '' : ENDIF : SET &CNT# = &CNT# + 1
: ENDWHILE
: P ***** FILE ALL THE STRING OF JOBS : SET &ROW# = 1 : SET &CNT# = 1 : SET &LEN# = LENGTH(&END_ARR#[], SIZE) : P tHE LEN &LEN# : SET &JOB_NAME# = &END_ARR#[&CNT#] : WHILE &CNT# <= &LEN# : P THE JOB_NAME = &JOB_NAME# : SET &JOB_SUCCESSOR# = PREP_PROCESS_VAR(&CON_WF#, , &JOB_NAME#, 2) : PROCESS &JOB_SUCCESSOR# : IF GET_PROCESS_INFO(&JOB_SUCCESSOR#, ROWS)= 0 : SET &NEXT_JOB# = 'END' : ENDIF : ENDPROCESS : CLOSE_PROCESS &JOB_SUCCESSOR#
: SET &ORD_CNT# = 2 : SET &ORDER_ARR#[1] = &JOB_NAME# : SET &PRE_JOB# = &JOB_NAME# : SET &PRE_JOB_EXIST# = 'TRUE' : WHILE &PRE_JOB_EXIST# = 'TRUE' : SET &JOBS# = PREP_PROCESS_VAR(&CON_WF#, , &PRE_JOB#, 2) : SET &ROWS_WF# = GET_PROCESS_INFO(&JOBS#, ROWS) : P &&ROWS_WF# &ROWS_WF# &&PRE_JOB# = &PRE_JOB#
: SET &HOLD_JOB# = &PRE_JOB#
: IF &ROWS_WF# = 0 : SET &CURRENT_JOB# = &PRE_JOB# : SET &PRE_JOB# = '' : ENDIF : PROCESS &JOBS# : SET &CURRENT_JOB# = &PRE_JOB# : SET &PRE_JOB# = GET_PROCESS_LINE(&JOBS#, 2) : SET &ORDER_ARR#[&ORD_CNT#] = &PRE_JOB# : P *** ORDER_ARR &ORDER_ARR#[&ORD_CNT#] : SET &ORD_CNT# = &ORD_CNT# + 1 : P &&PRE_JOB# &PRE_JOB# &CNT# : ENDPROCESS : CLOSE_PROCESS &JOBS# : IF &PRE_JOB# = '' : SET &PRE_JOB_EXIST# = 'FALSE' : ENDIF : ENDWHILE
: SET &LEN_ORDER# = LENGTH(&ORDER_ARR#[], SIZE) : SET &CNT_ORDER# = 1 : SET &COL# = 2 : SET &LNR# = 1 : P ****** START WRITTING TO THE FILE NUMBER OF RECORDS &LEN_ORDER# : WHILE &CNT_ORDER# <= &LEN_ORDER# : P &ORDER_ARR#[&LEN_ORDER#] : SET &UPDATE_VARA# = 'TRUE' : SET &REC# = PREP_PROCESS_VAR(&CON_WF_CR#, &ORDER_ARR#[&LEN_ORDER#]) : PROCESS &REC# : SET &LNRR# = GET_PROCESS_LINE(&REC#, 6) : PRINT &&LNRR# &LNRR# : IF &LNRR# <> '' : SET &UPDATE_VARA# = ''FALSE' : ENDIF : ENDPROCESS : CLOSE_PROCESS &REC# : p THE VALUE OF &&UPDATE_VARA# &UPDATE_VARA# C &COL# R &ROW# LNR &LNR# LOC &LOC# : IF &UPDATE_VARA# = 'TRUE' : SET &COL# = FORMAT(&COL#, '0') : SET &ROW# = FORMAT(&ROW#, '0') : SET &LNR# = FORMAT(&LNR#, '0') : SET &LOC# = FORMAT(&LOC#, '0') : PUT_VAR_COL &CON_WF_CR#, &ORDER_ARR#[&LEN_ORDER#], 1, &COL# : PUT_VAR_COL &CON_WF_CR#, &ORDER_ARR#[&LEN_ORDER#], 2, &ROW# : PUT_VAR_COL &CON_WF_CR#, &ORDER_ARR#[&LEN_ORDER#], 3, &LNR# : PUT_VAR_COL &CON_WF_CR#, &ORDER_ARR#[&LEN_ORDER#], 5, &LOC# : SET &COL# = &COL# + 1 : SET &LNR# = &LNR# + 1 : SET &LOC# = &LOC# + 1 : ENDIF : SET &LEN_ORDER# = &LEN_ORDER# - 1 : ENDWHILE : CLEAR &ORDER_ARR#[] : SET &CNT# = &CNT# + 1 : SET &ROW# = &ROW# + 1 : SET &COL# = &COL# + 1 : SET &JOB_NAME# = &END_ARR#[&CNT#] : ENDWHILE :ENDIF

:SET &CLIENT = SYS_ACT_CLIENT() :SET &SYSTEM = GET_UC_SYSTEM_NAME() !Let's determine which hosts are not supposed to be running and skip !notification if they are listed in the variable VARA.UNUSED.AGENTS.&CLIENT :SET &BADHOST# = GET_VAR("VARA.UNUSED.AGENTS.&CLIENT", &HOST#) : IF &BADHOST# = "&HOST#" : STOP NOMSG :ENDIF ! Let's figure out what email address to send the notification ! to per SYSTEM. WLPRDUC4 PROD will be gecsgiscpe, ! and WLDEVUC4 DEV will be gisautomic. :IF &SYSTEM = "WLPRDUC4" : SET &MAIL = "gecsgiscpe@email.wal-mart.com" :ELSE : SET &MAIL = "gisautomic@wal-mart.com;BHudgins@walmartlabs.com" :ENDIF ! :ENDIF ! :ENDIF ! !Now, lets check the hosts that are supposed to be "Alive" :IF SYS_HOST_ALIVE("&HOST#") = "N" : SET &OUT# = SEND_MAIL("&MAIL",,"Agent &HOST# in &SYSTEM:&CLIENT is down","Agent &HOST# in &SYSTEM:&CLIENT is not active",) :ENDIF

!********************************************************************************** !** IMPORT_JOBS_FROM_THE_FILE_SYSTEM !** Purpose: This will look for a file with an email address and try to import !** the jobs from the email file !********************************************************************************** :INC JOBI.SET_ENVIRNOMENT_VARIABLES :SET &FILE_TO_READ# ='&EXPORT_DIR#&SLASH#*@*.COM' :SET &HND# = PREP_PROCESS_FILENAME(&AGENT#, "&FILE_TO_READ#", "Y", "N", , , , 'UC_LOGIN=&LOGIN#') :PROCESS &HND# : PSET &EMAIL# = GET_PROCESS_LINE(&HND#) : p &EMAIL# : SET &RUNID# = ACTIVATE_UC_OBJECT(SCRI.PROCESS_EMAIL,,,,,PASS_VALUES) :ENDPROCESS :CLOSE_PROCESS &HND# :print PROCESS IS COMPLETE.

!********************************************************************************** !** Import the data from the XML file !** Purpose: This will read the XML file gather all the part of the data to build !** the jobs and the workflow. !**********************************************************************************
!Set which file and directory to read. :SET &FILE_TO_READ# = STR_LC('&FILE_PATH#&FILE_NAME#.item') !Creates a handle to the XML file. :SET &HND# = PREP_PROCESS_FILE(&AGENT#, &FILE_TO_READ#)
!Build the VARAs to hold the data extracted. :INC JOBI.CREATE_VARA ! :INC JOBI.INCR.COUNTER
:PSET &JOB_CNT# = 1 ! :SET &JOB_CNT# = &CNT# !Get a connection to the XML that will be written to disk used later to import :SET &XML# = XML_PROCESS_TO_DOM(&HND#)
:INC JOBI.COUNT_THE_NODES
!Set the pointer to the file of the first 'node' :SET &XML# = XML_SELECT_NODE(&XML#, "node") :SET &COMP_NAME# = XML_GET_ATTRIBUTE(&XML#, "@componentName") :SET &COMP_NAME# = STR_UC(&COMP_NAME#)
!Loop until all the nodes have been read. :WHILE &COMP_NAME# <> "" : SET &SUBELEMENT# = XML_GET_FIRST_CHILD(&XML#) : SET &COMP_NAME# = XML_GET_ATTRIBUTE(&XML#, "@componentName") : SET &COMP_NAME# = STR_UC(&COMP_NAME#) : print **** Comp Name - &COMP_NAME# ! Check to see if it one of the talend components. : IF &COMP_NAME# <> ""
: SET &VALID# = GET_VAR(VARA.VALID_TALEND_COMPONENTS, &COMP_NAME#) : print &&valid# = &VALID# ! Update the VARA to add a component that does not already exist. : IF &VALID# = "" : PUT_VAR VARA.VALID_TALEND_COMPONENTS, &COMP_NAME#, 'PLACEHOLDER' : SET &VALID# = GET_VAR(VARA.VALID_TALEND_COMPONENTS, &COMP_NAME#) : ENDIF : SET &isACTIVE# = 'TRUE' : PSET &PARAM_DATA# = 'FALSE' : INCLUDE JOBI.GET_JOB_DATA : WHILE &SUBELEMENT# <> "" ! Get the name and value of the XML component. : INC JOBI.GET_XML_ATTRIBUTE : PRINT "attribute value: &NAME# &value#" : SWITCH &NAME# ! Activate determines if the component is active. : CASE ACTIVATE : SET &isACTIVE# = &VALUE# : SET &SUB_SUBELEMENT# = "" ! Process is the job that will execute once the job is build. : CASE PROCESS : SET &PROCESS# = STR_UC(&VALUE#) : CASE UNIQUE_NAME : SET &JOBNAME# = &VALUE# ! Label is the actual name of the job. : CASE 'LABEL' : IF &TALEND_JOBS# = 'UKASDA' : SET &JOB_PROCESS# = &FILE_NAME_KEY# : ELSE : SET &JOB_PROCESS# = &VALUE# : IF &JOB_PROCESS# = '__PROCESS__' : SET &JOB_PROCESS# = &PROCESS# : ELSE : IF &CNT_NODES# = 1 : SET &JOB_PROCESS# = &FILE_NAME_KEY# : ENDIF ! : SET &JN# = SUBSTR(&JOB_PROCESS#,1,2) ! : SET &JN# = STR_UC(&JN#) ! : IF &JN# <> 'JB' ! : SET &JOB_PROCESS# = &FILE_NAME_KEY# ! : ENDIF : ENDIF : ENDIF : SET &JOB_PROCESS# = STR_SUB(&JOB_PROCESS#, '_', '.') ! Process throught to get all the parameters of the job. : CASE CONTEXTPARAMS : IF &isACTIVE# = 'TRUE' : SET &SUB_SUBELEMENT# = XML_GET_FIRST_CHILD(&SUBELEMENT#) : INCLUDE JOBI.GET_JOB_PARAM_DATA : ENDIF : ENDSWITCH : SET &SUBELEMENT# = XML_GET_NEXTSIBLING(&SUBELEMENT#)
: ENDWHILE ! :SET &RUNID# = ACTIVATE_UC_OBJECT(SCRI.CHECK.FOR.MISSING.PARAMETERS,,,,,PASS_VALUES) : P ************** You have processed a jobrun : IF &isACTIVE# = 'TRUE' : SET &JOBNAME# = STR_UC(&JOBNAME#) : SET &JOB_PROCESS# = STR_UC(&JOB_PROCESS#)
: SET &FILE_NAME_KEY# = STR_UC(&FILE_NAME_KEY#) : PRINT ****&JOBNAME# ! Valid Placeholder indicates it is one of the talend components but we are just ! building a job as a placeholder. : IF &VALID# = 'PLACEHOLDER' : PSET &JOB_CNT# = &JOB_CNT# + 1 ! If it is a placehold and a WaitForFile then it will build and file event. : IF &COMP_NAME# <> 'TWAITFORFILE' : PUT_VAR &CON#, &JOBNAME#, &COMP_NAME#, , , , &JOB_CNT# : ELSE : PUT_VAR &CON#, &JOBNAME#, &JOB_PROCESS#, , , , &JOB_CNT# ! Build a file event : SET &XML_EVNT# = CREATE_PROCESS(NEW) ! Create the directory : SET &DOC# = PREP_PROCESS_DOCU("DOCU.FILE.EVENT", Docu) : PROCESS &DOC# ! Get the XML from the Document Object replacing script variables using STR_SUB_VAR : SET &LINE# = GET_PROCESS_LINE(&DOC#, , STR_SUB_VAR) : SET &RET# = PUT_PROCESS_LINE(&XML_EVNT#, &LINE#) : ENDPROCESS : CLOSE_PROCESS &DOC#
: SET &OBJECT_TYPE# = "EVNT" : SET &IMPORT_DIR# = &JOBS_DIR# : P THE IMPORT DIRECTORY IS &IMPORT_DIR# : SET &EXPORT_FILE# = GET_VAR(VARA.ENVIRONMENT, EXPORT_FILE) : SET &EXPORT_FILE# = RESOLVE_VAR(&EXPORT_FILE#) : P XML file &EXPORT_FILE# : SET &RET# = WRITE_PROCESS(&XML_EVNT#, &EXPORT_FILE#, &AGENT#, &LOGIN#, OVERWRITE) ! Import the XML file : SET &RET# = IMPORT(&EXPORT_FILE#, &IMPORT_DIR#, 1, 1) : CLOSE_PROCESS &XML_EVNT# : ENDIF : ELSE ! The job does not exist but we need to check to see if the job is actually ! a workflow : SET &WF# = SUBSTR(&PROCESS#, 3) : SET &WF# = STR_CAT('WF', &WF#) : SET &WF# = STR_SUB(&WF#, "_", ".") : SET &OBJ_TYPE# = GET_OH_IDNR(&WF#) : p **** The jobname &WF# obj_type &OBJ_TYPE# : IF &OBJ_TYPE# > 0 : SET &PROCESS# = &WF# : ENDIF
! If the job uses a framework then JOB_INC will be populated with the correct ! framework. : PSET &JOB_CNT# = &JOB_CNT# + 1 : IF &JOB_INC# <> "" : SET &PROCESS# = STR_CAT(":INC ", &JOB_INC#) : SET &PROCESS# = STR_UC(&PROCESS#) : SET &JOB_PROCESS# = STR_SUB(&JOB_PROCESS#, " ", ".") : SET &JOB_PROCESS# = STR_SUB(&JOB_PROCESS#, "_", ".") : PUT_VAR &CON#, &JOBNAME#, &JOB_PROCESS#, &PROCESS#, , , &JOB_CNT# : ELSE : SET &PROCESS# = STR_SUB(&PROCESS#, "_", ".") : PUT_VAR &CON#, &JOBNAME#, &PROCESS#, &PROCESS#, , , &JOB_CNT# : ENDIF : ENDIF
! : INCLUDE JOBI.INCR.COUNTER ! : SET &JOB_CNT# = &CNT# : ENDIF
: P &&PROCESS# = &PROCESS# &&JOBNAME# = &JOBNAME# : ENDIF
: SET &XML# = XML_GET_NEXTSIBLING(&XML#)
:ENDWHILE
:set &runid# = import('/app/gec/edw/log/import/log/JOBS.0001180746_JB.EXT.FINANCE.US.YFS.PAYMENT_0001182087.xml')

!********************************************************************************** !** Process EMAIL !** Purpose: This will look for a file with an email address and try to import !** the jobs from the email file. The script will then send an email back to the !** email address to confirm to them that the jobs have been imported. !** This routine is call from SCRI.IMPORT_JOBS_FROM_THE_FILE_SYSTEM !********************************************************************************** !** :DEFINE &STRINGS#, string, 100 :PSET &RUNID# = &$RUNID# :FILL &STRINGS#[] = STR_SPLIT(&EMAIL#, &SLASH#) : SET &LEN# = LENGTH(&STRINGS#[], SIZE) : PSET &EMAIL_ADDR# = &STRINGS#[&LEN#] :SET &RET# = IMPORT(&EMAIL#, '\IMPORT', 1, 1) :SET &HLD# = ACTIVATE_UC_OBJECT(CALL.PROCESS_IMPORT,,,,,PASS_VALUES)

!********************************************************************************** !** Process XML !** Purpose: This will read the XML to see if it contains framework jobs if it does !** then it will active the workflow JOBP.RUN_IMPORT to extract the data then build !** the jobs and build the workflow. !********************************************************************************** !** :P ******Starting Process XML :DEFINE &STRINGS#, string, 100 :SET &PROCESSED_RECORDS_CNT# = 0 :SET &ALL_ITEMS_BUILT# = 'FALSE'
!** The VARA_HOLDING# is used to keep track of sub components in a XML.If any are found !** the system will build them first then the parent. :P **** &&FILE_NAME_KEY# IS &FILE_NAME_KEY# :DELETE_VAR &VARA_HOLDING#, &FILE_NAME_KEY#
!Set the variable to the file to read. :SET &FILE_TO_READ# = STR_LC('&FILE_PATH#&FILE_NAME#.item') :SET &HND# = PREP_PROCESS_FILE(&AGENT#, &FILE_TO_READ#) !Create a connection to the XML file. :SET &XML# = XML_PROCESS_TO_DOM(&HND#) :P **** CREATING PROCESS TO DOM ! Set the pointer in the file to the "node" section and get the name of the componentName. :SET &XML# = XML_SELECT_NODE(&XML#, "node") :SET &NAME# = XML_GET_ATTRIBUTE(&XML#, "@componentName") !Upper case the name of the object. :SET &NAME# = STR_UC(&NAME#) :P &NAME#
!Loop through all the node :WHILE &NAME# <> "" : SET &SUBELEMENT# = XML_GET_FIRST_CHILD(&XML#)
! Get the attribute name : SET &NAME# = XML_GET_ATTRIBUTE(&XML#, "@componentName") : P Name of Node - &NAME# : SET &isACTIVE# = 'True' : IF &NAME# <> '' : SET &PROCESSED_RECORDS_CNT# = 1 : P ***** THE JOBS NEEDS TO BE PROCESS... *****
: WHILE &SUBELEMENT# <> "" ! Get the name and value of the XML component. : INC JOBI.GET_XML_ATTRIBUTE
: SWITCH &NAME# ! Activate determines if the component is active. : CASE 'ACTIVATE' : SET &isACTIVE# = &VALUE# : SET &SUB_SUBELEMENT# = "" ! Process is the job that will execute once the job is build. : CASE 'PROCESS' : SET &PROCESS# = STR_UC(&VALUE#) : p &PROCESS# IS ACTIVE &isACTIVE# : IF &isACTIVE# = 'True' ! Check to see if the object already exist. 0 means the object is new. : SET &OBJECT_ID# = GET_OH_IDNR(&PROCESS#) : P THE OBJECT ID IS &OBJECT_ID# : IF &OBJECT_ID# <> 0 : SET &ALL_ITEMS_BUILT# = 'TRUE' ! CLEAN_UP is a keeper for all VARA built. One the process is done it is used ! to remove all temp VARAs created. : DELETE_VAR &CLEAN_UP#, &FILE_NAME_KEY# : ELSE ! Check to see if the process is part of the framework. : IF GET_VAR(VARA.COMMON.FUNCTION, &PROCESS#)<> '' : P *** COMMON FUNCTION : SET &ALL_ITEMS_BUILT# = 'TRUE' : ELSE : SET &PROCESS_TEMP# = SUBSTR(&PROCESS#, 3) : SET &PROCESS_TEMP# = STR_CAT("WF", &PROCESS_TEMP#) : SET &PROCESS_TEMP# = STR_SUB(&PROCESS_TEMP#, "_", ".") : P **** PROCESS_TEMP IS &PROCESS_TEMP# : SET &OBJECT_ID# = GET_OH_IDNR(&PROCESS_TEMP#) : IF &OBJECT_ID# > 0 : DELETE_VAR &CLEAN_UP#, &FILE_NAME_KEY# : ELSE : P THE OBJECT DOES NOT EXIST : SET &ALL_ITEMS_BUILT# = 'FALSE' : SET &DIR_FILE# = str_lc('&FILE_PATH#&PROCESS#*.item') : SET &HND1# = PREP_PROCESS_FILENAME(&AGENT#, &DIR_FILE#, "Y", "N", , , , 'UC_LOGIN=&LOGIN#') : PROCESS &HND1# : SET &LINE# = GET_PROCESS_LINE(&HND1#) : FILL &STRINGS#[] = STR_SPLIT(&LINE#, &SLASH#) : SET &LEN# = LENGTH(&STRINGS#[], SIZE) : SET &POS# = STR_LENGTH(&STRINGS#[&LEN#])
! Remove the item extension from the file name : SET &POS# = &POS# - 5 : SET &FILE_NAME_KEY_TEMP# = SUBSTR(&STRINGS#[&LEN#], 1, &POS#) ! : SET &FILE_NAME_KEY_TEMP# = STR_SUB(&FILE_NAME_KEY_TEMP#, '_', '.') : ENDPROCESS : CLOSE_PROCESS &HND1# : SET &PROCESS# = STR_UC(&PROCESS#) ! : SET &PROCESS# = STR_SUB(&PROCESS#, '_', '.') : P &FILE_NAME_KEY_TEMP# AND &PROCESS# GOING IN THE HOLDING FILE : PUT_VAR &VARA_HOLDING#, &PROCESS#, &FILE_NAME_KEY_TEMP# : PUT_VAR &CLEAN_UP#, &FILE_NAME_KEY#, 'NO' : ENDIF : ENDIF : ENDIF : ENDIF : ENDSWITCH ! Get the next node : SET &SUBELEMENT# = XML_GET_NEXTSIBLING(&SUBELEMENT#) : ENDWHILE : ENDIF : SET &XML# = XML_GET_NEXTSIBLING(&XML#) :ENDWHILE
!This code will first see if the build for the job/workflow is begun, if so then if will !not evoke a new build. Second, if not, then it all the components exist it will build the !workflow. :P *** &&ALL_ITEMS_BUILT# &ALL_ITEMS_BUILT# AND KEY IS &FILE_NAME_KEY# :IF &ALL_ITEMS_BUILT# = 'TRUE' : SET &WFLOOP_JOBS# = PREP_PROCESS_VAR(VARA.CHECK_FOR_DUPLICATE_JOBS) : SET &ROWS1# = GET_PROCESS_INFO(&WFLOOP_JOBS#, ROWS) : CLOSE_PROCESS &WFLOOP_JOBS# : SET &ROWS1# = FORMAT('0', &ROWS1#) : IF &ROWS1# = 0 : SET &QUEUE# = QUEUE.&TALEND# : SET &ALIAS# = &FILE_NAME_KEY# ! Change to with or with no Master based on the need -- per Rodney ! SET &OBJECT_TO_ACTIVATE# = 'JOBP.RUN_IMPORT_NO_MASTER' : SET &OBJECT_TO_ACTIVATE# = 'JOBP.RUN_IMPORT'
: SET &act_runid# = ACTIVATE_UC_OBJECT(&OBJECT_TO_ACTIVATE#, , , , , PASS_VALUES,&QUEUE# , &ALIAS#) ! : INC JOBI.SET_TIME_DELAY ! : INC JOBI.ACTIVATE_OBJECT &ALIAS# = &FILE_NAME_KEY# ! if an error occurs act_runid will be a 0. : INC JOBI.OUTPUT_ERROR : ENDIF :ENDIF

!Get the user to the email ! :set &userid# = SYS_USER_NAME ! :set &dep# = SYS_USER_DEP ! :ADD_ATT OPERATOR, '&userid#/&dep#' ! :pset &name# = &UC_CAUSE_NAME :pset &parentname# = SYS_ACT_PARENT_NAME('ACT') :pset &parentnr# = SYS_ACT_PARENT_NR('ACT') :pset &parenttyp# = SYS_ACT_PARENT_TYP('ACT') :pset &system# = GET_UC_SYSTEM_NAME :pset &client# = SYS_ACT_CLIENT :pset &date# = SYS_DATE_PHYSICAL() :pset &time# = SYS_TIME_PHYSICAL("HH:MM:SS") :pset &lang# = SYS_USER_LANGUAGE :PSET &ERRNR# = SYS_LAST_ERR_NR() :PSET &ERRINS# = SYS_LAST_ERR_INS() :pSET &MESSAGE# = GET_MSG_TXT(&ERRNR#,&ERRINS#) :P &NAME# :SET &OBJECT_TO_ACTIVATE# = CALL.JOB.FAILED :SET &QUEUE# = CLIENT_QUEUE :SET &ALIAS# = '' :INC JOBI.ACTIVATE_OBJECT

:INC JOBI.SET_ENVIRNOMENT_VARIABLES
:PSET &SECOND_LOOP# = 'FALSE'
:DEFINE &STRINGS#, string, 100
:P ****** STARTING PROCESS ************
! This will read the directory and select all the files that have an .item extension. :SET &HND# = PREP_PROCESS_FILENAME(&AGENT#, "&FILE_DIR#&SLASH#*.item", "Y", "N", , , , 'UC_LOGIN=&LOGIN#') :PROCESS &HND# : SET &LINE# = GET_PROCESS_LINE(&HND#) ! : SET &LINE# = STR_UC(&LINE#) : FILL &STRINGS#[] = STR_SPLIT(&LINE#, &SLASH#) : SET &LEN# = LENGTH(&STRINGS#[], SIZE) : SET &POS# = STR_LENGTH(&STRINGS#[&LEN#])
! Remove the item extension from the file name : SET &POS# = &POS# - 5 : SET &FILE_NAME# = SUBSTR(&STRINGS#[&LEN#], 1, &POS#) ! Remove the version from the file name : SET &POS# = &POS# - 4 : SET &FILE_NAME_KEY# = SUBSTR(&STRINGS#[&LEN#], 1, &POS#) : SET &FILE_NAME_KEY# = STR_SUB(&FILE_NAME_KEY#, '_', '.') : PUT_VAR '&VARA_HOLDING_JOB#', &FILE_NAME_KEY#, &FILE_NAME# : PUT_VAR '&VARA_HOLDING_PROCESSED#', &FILE_NAME_KEY#, 'NO' :ENDPROCESS :CLOSE_PROCESS &HND#
:SET &OBJECT_TO_ACTIVATE# = SCRI.PROCESS_XML :INC JOBI.PROCESS_JOBS &PROCESS_JOBS# = &VARA_HOLDING_JOB#
:WHILE SYS_STATE_JOB_ACTIVE(SCRI.PROCESS_XML)= 'Y' SLEEP 40 :ENDWHILE
! Set the flag second_loop to process all the master jobs ! : PSET &SECOND_LOOP# = 'TRUE' :P ***** Second time around ****** :SET &OBJECT_TO_ACTIVATE# = JOBP.RUN_IMPORT
:SET &WFLOOP_JOBS# = PREP_PROCESS_VAR(&VARA_HOLDING_JOB#) :SET &ROWS# = GET_PROCESS_INFO(&WFLOOP_JOBS#, ROWS) :p The number of rows &ROWS# :CLOSE_PROCESS &WFLOOP_JOBS#
:INC JOBI.PROCESS_JOBS &PROCESS_JOBS# = &VARA_HOLDING#
:WHILE SYS_STATE_JOB_ACTIVE(JOBP.RUN_IMPORT)= 'Y' SLEEP 40 :ENDWHILE
:INC JOBI.PROCESS_JOBS &PROCESS_JOBS# = &VARA_HOLDING_JOB#
:SET &DATE# = GET_VAR(VARA.ENVIRONMENT,SYSDATE_1) :set &date# = RESOLVE_VAR(&date#)) :PRINT &DATE#
